abstract: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss are using prodigious winnings from their legal settlement with Facebook to build a portfolio of investments in start-up Internet businesses. The latest is a $750,000 investment in Hukkster, a start-up shopping Web site.
snippet: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss are using prodigious winnings from their legal settlement with Facebook to build a portfolio of investments in start-up Internet businesses. The latest is a $750,000 investment in Hukkster, a start-up shopping Web site...
lead_paragraph: While many are still lamenting the failures of the Facebook‘s initial public offering, two of its most well-known shareholders are no longer wringing their hands.

headline.main: Winklevoss Twins Lead Investment in Start-Up Shopping Site
